DataElement.preferredName: Person Glucose Tolerance Test Laboratory Result Value in mg/dL
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._A test that involves administration of a know quantity of glucose as a means of screening for glucose intolerance or diabetes mellitus. Typically a baseline (fasting plasma or serum glucose) is drawn prior to the administration of the glucose bolus.  Serial plasma glucose levels are obtained (e.g. 30min, 1hr, 2hr, 3hr) and a plot of plasma glucose versus time is created.  Comparison of these values against standardized results can be used in establishing the diagnosis of glucose intolerance or diabetes mellitus._A laboratory result using the metric measure of milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._A test that involves administration of a know quantity of glucose as a means of screening for glucose intolerance or diabetes mellitus. Typically a baseline (fasting plasma or serum glucose) is drawn prior to the administration of the glucose bolus.  Serial plasma glucose levels are obtained (e.g. 30min, 1hr, 2hr, 3hr) and a plot of plasma glucose versus time is created.  Comparison of these values against standardized results can be used in establishing the diagnosis of glucose intolerance or diabetes mellitus.

Property.preferredDefinition: A test that involves administration of a know quantity of glucose as a means of screening for glucose intolerance or diabetes mellitus. Typically a baseline (fasting plasma or serum glucose) is drawn prior to the administration of the glucose bolus.  Serial plasma glucose levels are obtained (e.g. 30min, 1hr, 2hr, 3hr) and a plot of plasma glucose versus time is created.  Comparison of these values against standardized results can be used in establishing the diagnosis of glucose intolerance or diabetes mellitus.

Concepts.definition: A test that involves administration of a know quantity of glucose as a means of screening for glucose intolerance or diabetes mellitus. Typically a baseline (fasting plasma or serum glucose) is drawn prior to the administration of the glucose bolus.  Serial plasma glucose levels are obtained (e.g. 30min, 1hr, 2hr, 3hr) and a plot of plasma glucose versus time is created.  Comparison of these values against standardized results can be used in establishing the diagnosis of glucose intolerance or diabetes mellitus.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A laboratory result using the metric measure of milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Laboratory; a workplace for the conduct of scientific research.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.
A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/20/13 unretired; VD reused outside FBPP content. jc  2/9/12 - Retired as part of content cleanup activities per concurrence with Jenny Larkin (NHLBI).
